website_summaries.verdict: Clear areas of leaves and debris with the power of a 40-volt battery in this sweeper/blower.
pros: Power sweeper is ideal on concrete and other hard surfaces such as garages, driveways, sidewalks, patios
Also works on lawn for clearing debris
Built-in scraper on blow tube helps loosen matted leaves and other materials to help clear
Power Command controls help manage power and run-time
cons: Not as good at blowing leaves and debris from lawn

customer_reviews.title: longer than expected run-time and easy operation. In my wife's opinion the only negative ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this a five but my wife thinks it should be a 4.5: pluses include light weight, longer than expected run-time and easy operation. In my wife's opinion the only negative is that it doesn't have sufficient power to blow heavy leaves (especially magnolia) and doesn't meet her needs for cleaning her mower deck. I mainly use it for sweeping sidewalks and the drive way and it is more than powerful enough for those. I am 68 with arthritis in my wrists and I couldn't love it more.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Ribelin

customer_reviews.title: Save Yourself The Trouble !
customer_reviews.text: I own the B&D 40 volt string trimmer and hedge trimmer both of which are top notch. In keeping with staying with the B&D 40 volt line ... I decided to try this leaf blower in spite of the poor performance reviews. The result was the poor reviews were right. This blower will blow cotton balls off a table top but little else. Save yourself the trouble and save Amazon.com from having to issue you a refund. It shouldn't even be on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Jones

customer_reviews.title: It Does The Job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit primarily because I already have a B&D 36V/40V string trimmer and a couple of 40V rechargeable batteries. Although not as powerful as a corded blower, not having to drag out extension cords all the time is a BIG PLUS. It is lightweight, easy to put together and very easy to use. The 40V batteries last a long time. The unit does a nice job of clearing the grass cuttings off my driveway and sidewalk with plenty of battery power to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Marek

customer_reviews.title: I loved this blower when I first received it
customer_reviews.text: I loved this blower when I first received it, but I question its long term durability. The fan now rubs and whines and I am not sure how much more life it has left. It still works, but I fear it is coming to end of life. The pluses are that while it worked great in the beginning; good for blowing out the garage and cleaning the driveway of leaves and grass left over from mowing, it is a lightweight alternative. Not good for big jobs for sure.
customer_reviews.author: gdawg

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but concerned...
customer_reviews.text: This cordless sweeper is the perfect size and power for sweeping my front and back patios. I am pleased with how convenient it is to get those sweeping jobs done with minimal effort. I would give it five stars, but I've had it now for about 8 weeks and it's starting to make a scraping noise as the fan/motor is running. It still works. It works well. But I'm concerned that the scraping/binding sound will get worse over time. I'll keep my fingers crossed... for now though, it work quite well.
customer_reviews.author: AZ-Retired

customer_reviews.title: Black and Decker portable blower
customer_reviews.text: I like nothing about this blower. The weight is nothing to brag about.Its not heavy or light and the motor is too small to take seriously. Its like I have bout a leaf/grass blower but shouldn't use it for anything outside because if there is any wind it can negate the blower's affect. It would be interesting to know where they came up with the 120 MPH wind output since that is so easily overcome by a 15 MPH wind. Overall I will most probably toss the device and continue to use my Hitachi leaf blower which is a solid 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: john gowen

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I owned this leaf blower for a year and a half, but only used it about 15 times. I tried using it today (battery completely charged) and it did not work. Would not turn on. Took it to Lowe's to see if they could help me get it to work, and they were mystified. Lowe's said the blower looked brand new--which it is for all intents and purposes. Very disappointed in Black and Decker, which used to sell outstanding, dependable products. Won't buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Given

customer_reviews.title: Not very powerful at all.
customer_reviews.text: Not very powerful at all. I do not know if I received a defective unit or if this model is just not very powerful enough to blow medium piles of dry leaves. It's OK for blowing off leaves off a deck or a porch, but it's worthless for blowing fall leaves in a yard. And it makes a grinding noise as it operates. but it's still running. It's not worth my time to return and shop for a new one on Amazon. Moving towards the 'high dollar' brand name blowers that are only sold at local dealers to pay more, but know the quality far surpasses this lower end blower.
customer_reviews.author: Homeowner

customer_reviews.title: good blower for quick clean ups
customer_reviews.text: I like my Black and Decker blower for several reasons. I'm a small older woman and it's lightweight, it's battery driven so I can go anywhere AND not trip over a cord, it clears my deck and front walkway quickly. I still need to sweep because it's not as powerful as gas or electric. I have several B&D products that allow me to use the batteries that I have and also lets me do most of my own yard work. I trust the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Anne C Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Not very powerful
customer_reviews.text: My gas blower died so I was looking for battery powered replacement. I also have a B&D weed eater so I liked that I could use the same battery. I love not having the gas/pull anymore, and this is super light, but the power is sub-par so it takes me twice as long to blow the grass off my driveway and patio and it still doesn't do as good a job. It barely pushes the mulch off of my patio. It looks and feels like a kids toy, which isn't good if you want the power to blow away grass and small stones after mowing. It does the job, but I do miss the power of the gas blower.
customer_reviews.author: midge

customer_reviews.title: It Blows
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for quick and easy removal of neighbors leaves that always collect at my front door. Hands down beats cords and gas exhaust. Battery power and holding charge are 4 star outta 5. 40V Lithium-Ion LBX1540 & LBX2540 which is better’r (compare ratings). Purchased this 2nd unit for a elderly family member with the same issue, neighbors leaves at door. Also have B&D hedge trimmer that uses the same battery which is the reason I tried the blower. Blower is good for lite weight use like garage floors and quick cleanup jobs,...
customer_reviews.author: RNJ

customer_reviews.title: Eh.. Just O.K.
customer_reviews.text: It's lightweight alright.. So lightweight it hardly moves debris. It will do the job in a small area but honestly if I am confined to a small area, why not just sweep with a broom? It's lack of power leaves something to be desired. I would not buy nor would I recommend. Get something with more power otherwise you will be standing there looking like an idiot.
customer_reviews.author: Bill J

customer_reviews.title: Cordless, Lightweight but Low on Blower Power
customer_reviews.text: Have a corded super powerful blower BUT getting out cords, extensions, and putting away plus blower weight a strain at 78. At first "on" blower power so low I checked speed setting and thought of returning. But it is so light and waiting longer to blow clear no big deal AND no cords, LOL. It's a keeper for quick small areas.
customer_reviews.author: B. Speer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Junk
customer_reviews.text: Bought to sweep patio and driveway as it seemed easier than hooking up my corded Toro for a 15 minute task. Worked fine for that purpose initially but yesterday I went to sweep the patio and it started making serious grinding noises and would not get up to speed. I checked to make sure nothing had gotten into the impeller and it was clear so it appears the motor is dying. Cheap junk - should last longer than a little over a year (purchased in July of 2015).
customer_reviews.author: Senior One

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not a blower it’s a sweeper. There’s a big difference. This is for light duty. I have a corded blower that I use for spring and fall cleanup and that cord drives me nuts. The B&D sweeper is what i use to clean up the little debris, leaves, twigs, grass clippings etc. Very light and easy to use so I use it a lot. I don’t find my sweeper loud as others have noted. I always use it at level 6 (highest). Battery time is not very long but long enough to do all that I need. I also have the 40v trimmer which uses much less power. With two tools and two batteries I have no problems.
customer_reviews.author: jS

customer_reviews.title: Good product when used as a SWEEPER
customer_reviews.text: My first inclination was to rate this a three star, because I was comparing it to my Toro electric blower which has about three times the power. All this in spite of the fact that I read the reviews which reiterated, this is a sweeper, not a blower. Once I lowered my expectations to what it should be doing, I decided it was a fine product for that purpose. I already had the F&D 40 V. batteries so this was a pretty cheap investment and allows me to conveniently do more frequent smaller jobs without the hassle of a cord.
customer_reviews.author: Shoreline shopper

customer_reviews.title: This is a sweeper, not a blower
customer_reviews.text: We have a fairly large deck and patio under a large silver maple. Leaves are always falling. This sweeper does a nice job blowing off the leaves. Light enough for my wife to easily maneuver. When the big leaf drop happens in fall, I'll purchase a higher velocity/power gas blower. This one does what it's intended to do.
customer_reviews.author: KarlB

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, handy for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this B&D cordless sweeper as a replacement for same item, which suddenly stopped working after about 5 years. It is lightweight, has a range of power settings and is most handy for small jobs - cleaning light debris off a porch or deck, sidewalk, or short driveway. No cord to maneuver and easy to handle. This “sweeper” is just that - it isn’t designed for heavy use, like blowing an accumulation of leaves off the yard. Be sure to purchase an extra battery for this item.
customer_reviews.author: mbh

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and nicely made.
customer_reviews.text: Not as powerful as my corded Toro but it will do the job on most everything except large volumes of wet leaves. I have a battery operated B&D String Trimmer, the Chainsaw and not this to add to my B&D collection and I haven't been disappointed and the batteries last as long on high power as I want to work with these tools. I have noticed that if I keep the trigger pulled continuously the battery seems to last longer than if I trigger it on and off. Maybe just my perception.
customer_reviews.author: Preacher23

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Don't buy. I worked for a subsidiary of Black & Decker years ago...back when they made decent products. The sweeper burned out, outside of warranty. So I bought another one in April of 2020 and the battery is nearly impossible to install into the trimmer, and is impossible to install in the weed wacker/trimmer in the usual way. I had to use a clamp to force the battery into it. I received NO satisfaction from Black & Decker. AVOID!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M Collins

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect blower/sweeper for cleaning off the porch, patio, deck and outdoor steps. It is not heavy duty like a gas blower so don't waste your time with heavy grass clippings or a lot of leaves. There is a tree outside my side entrance that is constantly dropping little buds and helicopters on the stone patio and steps. I use this blower every day to clean off the debris so it doesn't get tracked into the house. Just turn it on and it's working, no gas to mix, or engine to prime. I love it and wouldn't be without it for the smaller jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Ron G

customer_reviews.title: Ultra light leav blower with a battery common to my weed eater and chain saw
customer_reviews.text: I got the weed eater with the 40v battery and loved the light weight, good power and quick battery recharge. I got the chain saw using the same battery. Amazing power in a small package. Now I have the leaf blower and I am amazed at the light weight and usefulness of the tool. Sweeps the porch and garage, cleans the neighbors gutters and blows the leaves away from the fence. Works so well I am getting my girl friend one for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: STEVE PHILLIPS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for for cleaning out the garage, sidewalks, and patios!
customer_reviews.text: It's not the most powerful blower in the world but it's good for cleaning out the garage, sidewalks, and patios. It's very lightweight. I originally purchased the 20V version but it lacked the power I desired so I returned it.This one will do fine for my small lot. I used to have an Echo gas backpack blower which was super powerful but I don't need that beast anymore and as a bonus I no longer smell like gasoline after blowing out the garage and driveway.
customer_reviews.author: MusicOdin

customer_reviews.title: Very limited in what it is good for.
customer_reviews.text: I have the B&D 40 V weed trimmer and am very happy with its performance and power. Given this experience I took a chance on 40 V blower for clearing my deck of leaves and my driveway and walkway of light grass clippings. The power is just not sufficient to move more light grass, dust and seedlings that fall from oak trees every spring. Forget moving anything that is slightly damp or moving anything that is in the grass. I will probably get a gas blower to handle most lawn related jobs and limit this blower to clearing the deck of those annoying seeds that come down.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A

customer_reviews.title: LSW36B blows, but not very well
customer_reviews.text: Very weak for a 36-40v blower. Only reason I bought this was I already had the hedge trimmer w/battery and charger and the hedge trimmer is great. It will sweep a garage floor ok but moving leaves is difficult. If you rapidly move it side to side or up and down it will loosen or float the leaves some then it will blow some. It is better than not having a blower but not by much.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Hall

customer_reviews.title: It's better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: It's better than I thought. It's very light even with a big battery on it. It's much easier to use than my gas blower, and no need to drag "line" multiple times. I like the battery instant ON feature. It may not be as powerful as the gas blower, but I just like the convenience.
customer_reviews.author: E.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick clean up
customer_reviews.text: This power blower is perfect for cleaning our the garage, blowing off the porch or sidewalk. It isn’t high powered enough to do heavy leaf clean up in the fall but for every day, keeping the sidewalks, porches and garage floor clean this is light weight and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, but underpowered...
customer_reviews.text: This works great for blowing out the garage or leaves off of the driveway. The battery makes it super convenient. Way too underpowered for any other tasks. Definitely useless for the yard. I bought a larger corded blower/vac for that work and it does great. Not sure I would have bought this cordless one if I had known that, but not having to take out a cord for the smaller jobs does mean I still use it occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: LearningMonkey

customer_reviews.title: great blower/sweeper
customer_reviews.text: This originally was a 20v design and was really good. For some insane reason B&D discontinued it and replaced it with a 20V lamo blower. Then they came out with the 40V model with the same nice design of the original 20v model. It is really good and the extra power is nice. I wish they had followed Dewalt's paradigm and made it 20/40 V so I could use my oder batteries. I give it a good 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Great for what I use it for, however.......
customer_reviews.text: Does not have near the power of my corded Toro blower. For moving a large amount of leaves I think you may be disappointed. However, I bought this for 'sweeping' the porch and clearing grass off the steps. For this is works great and I'm happy with the product. It has more than enough battery to do a 60 foot porch and two sets of steps. Battery is also interchangeable with my Black & Decker LST136W 40V Max Lithium String Trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Don't just don't!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this thing!! I read the reviews and they couldn't be more wrong! This blower/sweeper is so weak it will barely blow the leaves off my driveway without holding it right on the leaf. Cost me $152 for this Piece of junk. I didn't have anything else to use at the time, so I kept it. Take my advice and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: CindyT

customer_reviews.title: low velocity
customer_reviews.text: I have a B&D 40 volt string trimmer, hedge trimmer and chain saw they all perform very well, thought the blower was a no brainer to complete my collection. I held off purchasing this unit for a long time due to some underwhelming reviews. Should have waited for the next generation tools to come out. I'm hopeful someone in the B&D research and development team reads this review. Yours truly, Frank E Lennartz lennartzcarp@verizon.net
customer_reviews.author: frank lennartz

customer_reviews.title: Terrible waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Black+Decker leaf blower for just over a year. The only time I've used it is when leaves start to fall by our pool. First, it has never been very powerful, but this year when I pulled it out the battery, after being charged overnight, lasted about four minutes! I thought maybe I just didn't charge it right, so I changed plugs and made sure the green light was on. Waited several hours and tried again. Only lasted about three minutes! Terrible waste of money. I would like my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Georgianne

customer_reviews.title: Not Powerful, but handy
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this B&D battery powered blower. It is not all that powerful, and though I haven't tried it on wet leaves yet, I suspect it won't be able to do much with them. But for blowing a few leaves off my deck, or blowing sawdust or cobwebs away, it is quite handy and extremely light and maneuverable. Just don't expect it to do too much.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Z. Jody

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: Works GREAT ! !............for a couple of months. This is the 3rd one I have purchased. I love the light weight and the force of the blower. The problem is that after, oh I'd say 20 hours of use, the bearings in the blower start to make a terrible racket. I returned 1 for a replacement and the 2nd one I just went ahead and replaced it myself. If it wasn't for my Wife liking them so much, I would not recommend them. They WILL fail.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Thought battery will fit other tools..
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping the battery would fit my other B&D tool with same voltage specs. Nope. Now i have 2 b&d leaf blower with one working battery that i cant use on both - one was an older version. The only reason i did not return it was my old ones battery is done. It does run longer than the old version but so is other lithium battery powered tools with a lot more power and/or cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use, but not much power
customer_reviews.text: Great for cleaning out a garage or blowing light, dry debris off a small deck or porch. Not much power, though, so not as usual for larger driveways. Also not strong enough to blow larger debris (like pine cones or sticks), and doesn't work at all for anything wet. For bigger surfaces and yard work, I use my plug-in blower.
customer_reviews.author: DAS

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight easy to use and powerful blower
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used it a few times but it is wonderful for me. I am 70 and have a small patio with lots of pine needles and it is so much easier to use than previous gas powered or electric corded blowers.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia H.

customer_reviews.title: 40V lithium ion, You can't say no
customer_reviews.text: This cordless leaf blower is the best product on Amazon for the price. Pros: - cordless, light - adequate power for light applications - ergonomic handle - the battery charges fast and the application can run for more than half an hour - this leafblower is a great investment as it will save you an incredible amount of time as you do not have to deal with electrical wires and extenders Cons: - not for commercial usage - not powerful enough for large scale work
customer_reviews.author: Jovazon

customer_reviews.title: Better Alternative Than Gas Blowers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go with my B&D garden lineup of battery tools. Good for blowing dust and small leaves. If you want something more hardcore this is not the tool for you.
customer_reviews.author: MKJ808

customer_reviews.title: JUST WHAT WE NEEDED!
customer_reviews.text: It works well as a sweeper as intended. We blow leaves and pollen off the pool deck and the patio just fine. It even works well in the artificial grass we have in grandkids play area. We haven't had to recharge it yet, use it every other day or so and it still works fine. We have had quite a bit of wind too, and two big trees are both shedding lots of junk. We are happy that it is so lightweight and manageable since we are older and suffer from arthritis and husband has Parkinsons so yardwork is getting more difficult. This sweeper seems to be just what we needed!
customer_reviews.author: QueenGrandma

customer_reviews.title: weak
customer_reviews.text: I knew when I took it out of the box that the sheer size and weight of it would be a clue as to its performance. There is not enough power to blow the acorns off my deck and it took far too long to blow dust and pine needles on my driveway. Perhaps doubling the size of it would work for me. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More value for the money than you would ever expect
customer_reviews.text: I believe this barely weighs over 6 lb with the big 40-volt battery easy for myself and my wife to use drying off vehicles blowing leaves cleaning sand out from our back porch from the beach The battery lasts a long time and you're able to dial down the power and the battery will last 10 times as long incredible piece of machinery.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hanacek Jr

customer_reviews.title: Powerful enough for cleaning garage and walkway.
customer_reviews.text: Blowing speed is fine for what I need. Holds charge a long time. Like fact that it has no cord or doesn't need gas and a hard pull to start. When replacing battery after charging on charger that comes with it, must push hard to get it snapped back in place correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Great light-duty machine!
customer_reviews.text: As described in the product description, this "sweeper" is just that... a sweeper (rather than a blower). For light-duty moving of leaves, etc. from a sidewalk, driveway, patio, deck or what have you it is perfect. Not overly powerful, it has just enough to provide adequate wind while not quickly running out of juice from the battery along with not excessively noisy. I also have a B&W battery chainsaw that uses the same battery... great stuff all!
customer_reviews.author: Jerryy

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight good for light walkway and deck clearing
customer_reviews.text: My Fault for thinking this would push or move wet leaves yet still be light weight? It is a great outdoor sweeper!!!! I do like this for clearing off my front walkway and back deck which both get littered with leaves and other outdoor debris..... definitely a lightweight tool but has value for every day clearing of traffic areas........
customer_reviews.author: Sally Rietveld

customer_reviews.title: very misleading product advertisement
customer_reviews.text: The question is not whether the product works. I suppose it does. It's the very misleading nature of theproduct advertisement. There are actually three separate items you need to buy: the device, a 40 v battery and a charger. All are sold separately and there is no obvious indication in the product ad that all must be purchased separately. The ad makes the product look reasonably priced. In fact, it is not, once you add in the features that have to be purchased separately from the same merchant. It's hard to like a product that has been so deceptively packaged.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Cartwright

customer_reviews.title: I like it enough to keep it and use on my ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it enough to keep it and use on my porch, patio and long driveway and it has just enough power with some extra to spare after cleaning those surfaces. It gets the job done amazingly when you think it can't. The price is right until you have to pay for the battery but I'm satisfied to not have to deal with the use of cords or gas, so the payoff works. It's also lightweight and easy to use. It's "good" enough.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight & Easy to Handle
customer_reviews.text: Works great to "sweep" off the porches, driveway and sidewalk and garage. Battery lasts for about 3 uses before needing recharged. Has a battery charge indicator to tell how low battery capacity is getting. Purchased an extra battery to keep charged. Battery charger keeps extra battery fully charged at all times. But note, this is not a heavy duty yard blower.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little sweeper!
customer_reviews.text: It's not my monster gas-powered leaf blower, and sweetgum balls on the gutter guards or the lawn would just look at this and laugh, but for staying on top of leaves that fall on a big concrete patio so they don't get tracked inside, it's perfect. Quiet enough that I can run it in the early morning while it's still cool and not wake the neighborhood with a roaring gas engine, and it takes the same battery as my string trimmer, so I can switch if I run out of juice. Leaf-free patio without noise and adjusting a fussy choke, or picking up a broom. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: MeanAndPinchy

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the B&D blower and string trimmer. The equipment worked satisfactorily with a charged battery, but in a little over a year the battery would no longer hold a charge. Although the charge status indicator on the battery shows a full charge, the charger indicates that the battery is drained. I'm not sure what I need to replace. Disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Snekrqueen

customer_reviews.title: Not for the Deep South
customer_reviews.text: The LSW36 40-Volt Lithium Ion Cordless is handy but only for blowing light, dry debris short distances. I use it to clear the driveway and sidewalk after mowing. But it's not for dewey leaves or moist grass best handled by a gas or corded blower. I purchased the LSW36 40-Volt persuaded by a review that boasted that it could handle nearly an acre. Only if you have hours to spend blowing. The reviewer couldn't be from the Deep South. If you are then get this blower to clear a patio, deck or drive. But don't get rid of your gas or corded blower for your bigger jobs.
customer_reviews.author: TP Cortez

customer_reviews.title: Leaves Be Gone
customer_reviews.text: Update 1.5 years in: still running fine. This lightweight light duty blower is perfect to fight back the daily encroachment of nature's windblown detritus invading my garage. The knurled speed setting nob need be no more than a "2" setting to send leaves scuttling down the path toward my neighbor's property. No earplugs required and it goes weeks for me before needing recharging. In wet weather, which lately in Northern Cal means a few hours every year, a more robust machine is needed, but for 95% of the time, using this is so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Js

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: Its pretty light weight and feels a bit cheap. Sometimes it makes a bit of a noise like something isnt lined up properly and its grinding. But I have been using this for a couple years along with a B&D Weed Wacker and Hedge Trimmer and all are working great. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Just a Sweeper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because a had a trimmer and chain saw that had the same batteries. They are great! This, not so much. The motor appears not to generate a lot of torque. I use it to blow off the walkway after mowing, but if anything is wet it will not blow it away. Definitely cannot use for gutters.
customer_reviews.author: Rayboy

customer_reviews.title: Good product overall.
customer_reviews.text: I have the 20volt blower and wanted this for longer battery life and more cfm's. The good news is the battery does last longer and charges up much quicker than the 20V model. It is also much quieter. It is also balanced quite well and easy to handle. It doesn't seem to have any more cfm"s than the 20Volt though, disappointed about that. Have to use the max cfm control at 6 for decent performance. Don't know why they put a variable speed control when it has to be set to max to operate properly. They could have left that out of the design. Overall more pluses than minuses so am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very handy around the home
customer_reviews.text: This is the only blower that I've used. It has been very handy to blow dirt, sand and leaves out of the garage, driveway, deck etc. It feels a little under powered so you may have to move slowly and make multiple passes to move all of the debris. I use it often around the home and would recommend. I've had no problems with the battery and charging system. One thing that I don't like is that if you operate the blower with your right hand, your clothes can easily block the air intake.
customer_reviews.author: RickC

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This blower is perfect. It’s light weight (which my wife loves) and it’s easy to put away. The blowing power is not as strong as a backpack blower but it still does the job just fine. I use it on our grass to clear leaves and to clean our driveway after I trim and cut our grass. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott T.

customer_reviews.title: Great sweeper
customer_reviews.text: A lot people might think this is a leaf blower but it isn't. It's a sweeper it works great for taking the leaves off our back deck and the walk way between our garage and neighbor's fence. Plus the switches our yard trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Fluff

customer_reviews.title: Great on Light Duty work
customer_reviews.text: I got this B&D blower for light work. It cleans the garage out, does the driveway after mowing and I use it to dry my cars after washing them. Very light weight, but a little more power (even though it's adjustable) would be nice. For light leave work in the year it would probably be OK. Power adjust ability is nice to have to keep dust down if that is what you are doing. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Midwest

customer_reviews.title: So much easier than a broom for light jobs!
customer_reviews.text: This blower is ideal for blowing DRY grass or leaves off a hard surface! I blow off our deck every day in the late summer and early fall as the leaves are dropping -- so much quicker and easier than using a broom! I also use it to blow off the dried grass that accumulates on my garden tractor mower deck. It is NOT a good substitute for a gas blower or powerful corded electric blower, but for light jobs, it is great. It is also so much easier than dragging out the extension cord for my corded blower. Very glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does for air as a portable flashlight does for light.
customer_reviews.text: 90% of my jobs don't require a half horsepower engine. Blowing sidewalk clutter and garage floor dust is amazingly simple. Speed adjustment works very effectively. Well thought-out product. Nice to say goodbye to gasoline and extension cords for most jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Lum

customer_reviews.title: Meets my needs for battery use and power.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my B&D 18 volt blower. I was using 2-3 18 volt battery packs after mowing my yard and wanted something to last longer so I did not have to replace batteries. So far this has been the answer and I can use just one battery pack on the high setting and still have power left. It has both enough blowing power and lasting battery pack power to get the job done. Also, it charges faster than the 18 volt battery packs. I have had the 18 volt model for quite a few years and it has proven very durable. i hope the 40 volt model is as durable over time.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one I like it so much.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if the people who had negative views got a different product than I did, but I really like ours. It can do more than blow out a candle! I use it on the stone drive, decks and even inside the mud room.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Could be a bit more powerful(the reason for only 4 stars). We have an earlier B&D rechargeable blower which is more powerful, but the battery life on this model is really short. I guess this LSW36 model is a compromise between a powerful blow with shorter battery life and weaker blow with longer battery life. Works well when stuff your blowing is on the dry side. Wet materials are a slower job. Bought an extra battery pack so a fall leaf job can be completed without stopping. Recommend the extra battery if you have bigger jobs. Read the instructions for charging the battery. If you want a satisfactory battery charge, make note of the recommended temperature of the charging environment.
customer_reviews.author: xwxman

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: I have a big yard with 3 huge oak trees that cover my yard with leaves every fall. I'm a small women and can't tolerate using heavy yard tools or dragging around extension cords. This fit my needs perfectly. The 40 volt battery is plenty of power to get what I want done, but having 2 batteries is best. My yard is not all grass. It has moss, weeds, dirt and a little bit of everything in it. So this blower did exceptionally well. The weight is light and it's perfectly balanced weight.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight blower. Very convenient.
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is good, but the blowing power is a bit weaker than I expected. It is good for walks and driveways. Any heavy duty blowing still requires a 120 V blower. I have had for several months and it is making growling noises during direction changes. I think the gyroscopic forces are loosening the blowers mounting fastener. I have had this happen on other Black and Decker blowers. Update Mardh 22, 2017: The blower is still functioning fine and the growling noise has disappeared. This blower has laster much longer than I expected. It is a very hand tool.
customer_reviews.author: C. Beltle

customer_reviews.title: Drying Power??  Don't know what that category is for in the ratings
customer_reviews.text: Had an old ni-cad B&D set including trimmer, hedge shears and blower. The blower barely worked 15 minutes per charge while the other two did fine. This lithium version lasts a long time on a charge. Much much better.
customer_reviews.author: R. W. Gorham

customer_reviews.title: Cool Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with my B+D trimmer which i love. This unit has decent power for what i want, which is clearing grass from sidewalks, driveway, and patio. Handy for blowing out the garage too. I can trim and blow on the same battery on about 1/2 a charge. I like its light weight and it is relatively comfortable to use. So far very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Qball

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for patio and garage cleanup
customer_reviews.text: I love this little blower so much that I bought it as a housewarming gift for my daughter! I seldom use it on the higher settings as the low setting gives me good control over where I blow leaves, etc. I use it on the pool deck, porches, garage floor, etc. Holds a charge well, especially when used on low...
customer_reviews.author: M. Shell

customer_reviews.title: I upgraded from my 20V and this suits my needs 100%
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a 20V blower and this one is great. The 40V battery is much larger as an FYI. Not bulky and easy to use. Moves wet leaves and even magnolia leaves. I watched a you-tube video and it showed the mud scraper on the end of the tube. Works on the mud/soil that accumulates at the end of my driveway and sure beats using a shovel to scrape it off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this blower
customer_reviews.text: I love this blower. My husband bought it for me, when I told him I needed a light weight blower, that I could handle. His research led him to this. It is perfect and the battery life is great! We have a 1/2 acre, on a very steep lot. With stairs, and paths winding around several oak trees, that drop a ton of leaves all year long. I can usually get everything blown off on one charge. I am female 5'3" and in my sixties. It is lightweight and so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Smithy

customer_reviews.title: it's amazing. I use it to blow off the sidewalk ...
customer_reviews.text: This is not a full power lawn blower, and as long as you don't expect it, it's amazing. I use it to blow off the sidewalk and patio after mowing, clean out the garage, and on occasion have even opened the back door and blown the dust and dog hair from my kitchen out the back door. Battery life will get you 30-60 minutes at full power, depending on usage.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Works great as an electric broom!
customer_reviews.text: This will have a very hard time blowing a yard full of leaves. There’s just not enough power for that. It works great, however, for blowing leaves and dirt out of my garage. That’s what I bought it for anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Blower works okay but I'm very disappointed in the low power output
customer_reviews.text: Blower works okay but I'm very disappointed in the low power output. I have several other 40 volt tools (weed eater, chainsaw limb trimmer, etc.) which are all very powerful for being battery operated; this blower is not. I would not recommend it as I'm sure there are other makes in a similar price range that would perform much better. My son has a Ryobi 20v blower like this one that is a good bit better performer.
customer_reviews.author: flyer49

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: For being a 36 volt the power is weak, I have a 18volt that is stronger.. It is also very small in size however it works well.. I wanted it for my car to blow off the extra water before drying.. It's hard pressed to do that..
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, quiet and easy to use, a tool in a new category, but what is it?
customer_reviews.text: I really like this sweeper/blower thing, but not exactly for the reasons I bought it. When it came I realized this thing is really small, really really small. Look carefully at the overall dimensions, really light too in that all plastic but somehow durable way Black and Decker have perfected. This is NOT a replacement for a corded or gas blower unless you only work off hard surfaces. Grass is really hard to clear. What it does replace is every outdoor brush I use! Wow, I can "sweep" the entire garage in 1 minute or less. Set it to low, it is nice and quiet and runs a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Old Goat

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.....
customer_reviews.text: I've never written reviews before but this has been a perfect tool for me, doing exactly what I wanted. Lightweight and handy for blowing off my steps, sidewalk, deck and patio from all of the pollen and spring time debris from our oak, maple, and tulip poplar trees! I don't expect this to replace the powerful blower needed for leaves in the fall or even for grass clippings on the driveway. I'm getting good use between battery charges as I only need to run it for a few minutes each use. My only "criticism" is that it takes me a little extra effort to click the battery into place after recharging.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H.

customer_reviews.title: Best one
customer_reviews.text: You can never go wrong with Black & Decker. My husband now has the chainsaw, weed wacker, hedge trimmer, blower. The battery do last a long time before you will need to charge them.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Battery/Charger problem
customer_reviews.text: I think B&D has a battery problem. I ordered one of these units, charged the battery and used it once for about 30 minutes. A couple days later I go to use it and I see the battery charge indicator is flashing red which means there is a problem with the battery. The unit wouldn't run. I sent it back and got a new one. Same thing again, charged it up used it once, checked it a day later, flashing red. Think they have a bad batch of batteries or chargers going on. Sending the second one back, done with them.
customer_reviews.author: Security Guy

customer_reviews.title: Does a Nice Job
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my 84 year old Dad. He loves it for blowing off his porch and sidewalks - even uses it to blow leaves out of his yard. He has a B&D 40 Volt string trimmer and it sues the same batteries. Always nice to have tools that use the same size batteries. Great buy. Black & Decker has nice products for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Luvs 2 Cook

customer_reviews.title: It's not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be more powerful. I have a large patio and deck, and I thought this would be a fast and easy way to clean it weekly. It did not have the power to clean the leaves and debris from trees. I was disappointed. I have a large corded one, but wanted a powerful cordless one for weekly use.
customer_reviews.author: gkane

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for limited need blowing projects
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to deal with leaves on 2000 sq ft of artificial grass. Does a nice job with perfect power balance. Rechargeability is a major plus. Good practical solution to light weight blower issues.
customer_reviews.author: charlie badger

customer_reviews.title: and it won't destroy your hearing like my old back-pack rig
customer_reviews.text: After using a monster back-pack blower for the past few years, let me tell you that this thing is so much easier to use, and it won't destroy your hearing like my old back-pack rig. It moves a bit less air than a monster rig, so it takes 3 passes down a driveway to completely clear it of leaves and grass, versus two passes with a monster blower, but its weight, ease of use and tolerable noise levels makes this an easy choice. Battery lasts long enough to blow off a good length driveway and all of the sidewalks with ease. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: William T. Gast

customer_reviews.title: Really pleased with convenience
customer_reviews.text: Love having a cordless blower to clear off the driveway and patio. Not as forceful airflow as models with electrical cord, but the convenience was what I was looking to have. The battery life allows me to do the driveway and front and back patio areas; recharges quickly. Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Margaret E.

customer_reviews.title: Great blower.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my hubby who is the yardman in our family. He used it yesterday for the first time. and said it is great. Plenty of power for moving grass clippings. He used it after edging. We have a 1/2 acre lot. He used it for about 15 minutes and he said it had plenty of juice left. He loves that there are no noxious gas fumes or electrical cords to deal with. We have many oak trees and will be using it to blow away leaves in the fall. I will update my review then.
customer_reviews.author: dvdiva48

customer_reviews.title: On/Off Switch is very hard turn on & off.
customer_reviews.text: Nice light wt sweeper & battery lasts a long time. Very hard to turn on/off switch both on & off. Was hoping my grand kids could use the sweeper but they would not be able to turn the sweeper on & off. Took me 15 minutes to got the sweeper to turn on.
customer_reviews.author: RWG794

customer_reviews.title: and cordless feature is great, especially blowing around patio furniture and other things ...
customer_reviews.text: The blower was not packed in the original Black and Decker box, and didn't have any owners manual, which is different. The blower itself is ok. It doesn't blow very hard, even when turned up to its highest level. The battery, and cordless feature is great, especially blowing around patio furniture and other things which the cord would usually tangle with.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but a little anemic
customer_reviews.text: Nice little blower, probably not as good a value as a comparably-priced Stihl, but the latter is hard to find around here. Even at top setting, not much power to the blast of air.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Light weigh, light working sweeper
customer_reviews.text: It's called a sweeper so I have it two stars. It pushes grass clippings or dry leafs. It won't move much else. I'll be purchasing another device for my leafs and will probably sell this after since I won't have much use for it.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: OK for Some Uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with the 40 v battery that came with a hedge clipper (which is a great item). The time available with a fully charged battery is more than adequate for my use. However, the blowing force or power is barely adequate and increases the time spent blowing leaves. Not very useful with pine straw on concrete unless needles are sparse. I am keeping the item because it is useful around my pool where an electrical line is dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Fm Technology Inc.

customer_reviews.title: This my 2nd LSW36 blower. The first one didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: This my 2nd LSW36 blower. The first one didn't wear out but I left it out in the rain by mistake. Surprisingly, it still worked but it's life was shortened as a result. It does everything I need. Yard is .7 acre but I don't try to blow leaves off of the sod. Need a more substantial "blow" for that kind of thing.
customer_reviews.author: skeet

customer_reviews.title: This light weight sweeper is terrific. It does a great job in so little ...
customer_reviews.text: This light weight sweeper is terrific. It does a great job in so little time, and it holds the charge a long time. I could not be happier with this purchase. Worth every penny. I no longer sweep or hose outside areas. Ten times better than an overpowered blower I gave away. And this unit has adjustable speeds. This is far better than I was expecting. .
customer_reviews.author: Nick Skye

customer_reviews.title: Batteries dies fast, now it doesn't charge
customer_reviews.text: the complaint is mainly around the battery, it dies fast after very few times of use. And now it doesn't charge. I have two 40v batteries and the other one is still working but not as durable as it was before.
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Moves leaves. Great value perfect for smaller yards.
customer_reviews.text: Many people stated that the "Sweeper" does not adequately move leaves. I found it did a great job moving leaves from garden areas as well as scattered leaves on my yard into large piles. I will say it struggles to move large piles of leaves, but I mulched the piles of leaves anyway so that was not an issue. It also is great for cleaning out my garage efficiently. Very happy especially for the price. Does not compare to a gasoline leaf blower, again perfect for small suburban yards.
customer_reviews.author: Katea Kauffman

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from 18V sweeper to 36V is not only DOUBLE
customer_reviews.text: I have 7x 18V batteries for my Black & Decker string trimmer, sweeper and drill in last 7 years. Those 18V NiCd batteries are all worn out. Each can only run 3 minutes. I kept 4 chargers plugged to constantly recharge 4 batteries. But I could not finish my trim/sweep work by using 4 batteries only. I had to stop my yard work and wait for the next recharge done over night. Instead of buying additional 18V batteries, I decided to upgrade my tool set to 36V. That is a wonderful decision! LSW36 is very quiet, lighter, powerful and battery runs like endless. One 36V battery is enough for me to finish trim or sweep.
customer_reviews.author: fun2buy88

customer_reviews.title: Just slap in a charged battery, turn on power,  and get to work.
customer_reviews.text: Great for clearing off your sidewalks, porch, patio, etc after cutting grass. Plenty of power for that but not enough to blow dead leaves out of grass but you can get a corded blower for that. Lightweight, quiet, decent battery life. No buying gas and fuel oil, no fumes, no yanking on a corn, no maintenance, or no dragging an extension cord around the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy A Triplett

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I suppose this thing does accelerate a few molecules of air to a slightly faster speed, but not enough to displace anything on the ground like leaves or pine needles more than a desultory inch or so. Useless. It's disappointing because it uses the same battery as the excellent B&D hedge trimmer, which is a five star device.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jan

customer_reviews.title: It's very light weight and easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: This unit is small and not very powerful. I won't attempt to clean up a yard with it. But it does work well for blowing off a porch or cleaning out the garage. It's very light weight and easy to maneuver. I think the battery will last about 20 minutes, although I've never tested it until it was exhausted. It seems to be well made. I bought two of them.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I use this sweeper regularly. It is lightweight, easy to use, and goes a long way on a single charge. It is very convenient also. I purchased this because it uses the same battery as my hedge trimmer and line trimmer. It is a little under powered. As long as what you are sweeping is dry, it works fine. However, it just does not have the power to effectively clean my deck if the leaves are more than just slightly damp, whereas my corded blower cleans them right up. I do not regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Augustin

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER LSW36 40V Lithium Ion Cordless Sweeper, 24
product_meta.description:
Style:Sweeper KitThe BLACK+DECKER LSW36 40V Lithium Ion Sweeper has an efficient design that easily clears debris from hard surfaces like patios, decks, walkways, driveways and garages. Its soft grip handle provides added comfort during use. Its blow tube with built-in scraper allows users to loosen matted leaves and stuck-on debris. Air Speed: 120 mph; Decibels: <66 dBA; Included Components: LSW36 Cordless Sweeper/Vacuum, (1) LBX1540 40V MAX* Lithium Ion Battery, (1) LCS36 Fast Charger, (1) Blow Tube; Power Source: 40V MAX* Lithium Ion Battery; Type: Hard Surface Sweeper

AMAZON.COM


The lightweight, cordless LSW36 Sweeper. Power Command variable speed setting. Power up your yard cleanup with the cordless Black & Decker 40-volt Lithium Sweeper (model LSW36), which eliminates the weight, noise and hassles of gas-powered equipment. It's powered by Black & Decker's high-powered 40-volt lithium battery system, which offers power, excellent runtime, and the versatility to share batteries with other tools within the system. 

THE LITHIUM ADVANTAGE
Black & Decker's 40-volt lithium-ion system offers numerous benefits over older battery technologies and gas options, notably the ability to put more power into a small and compact battery. Lithium batteries have a longer lifecycle than other types, and they also hold their charge longer when taken off the charger. This means that once charged, a lithium battery is always ready to use. The included Energy Star-rated fast charger fully recharges the battery in about 1 hour.

CLEARS ALL TYPES OF DEBRIS
Ideal for hard surfaces like patios, decks, walkways, driveways, and garages, the Sweeper has an efficient design and a 120-mph air speed to make quick work of debris. It features Power Command controls for adjusting speed for maximum run-time or maximum power. The blow tube has a built-in scraper that enables the Sweeper to loosen matted leaves and stuck-on debris.

LIGHTWEIGHT FOR COMFORTABLE, ALL-DAY USE
Weighing in at just 4.7 pounds, this blower is light enough for anyone to use for extended periods. And it features a comfortable soft grip handle that's large enough for use with gloves. 

LOW NOISE LEVELS
The Sweeper's electric motor greatly reduces the roar that's common with gasoline blowers to protect your hearing and reducing noise pollution. It's rated at 66 dBA.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
LSW36 cordless Sweeper; LBX36 40-volt lithium-ion battery; LCS36 40-volt fast charger; blow tube; operating instructions

LSW36 LITHIUM SWEEPER KEY FEATURES:
 * Clears debris from hard surfaces like patios, decks, walkways, driveways and garages
   
   
 * 40-volt lithium-ion battery provides longer runtime and longer battery life year after year
   
   
 * Fast charger recharges 40-volt battery in about 1 hour
   
   
 * Power Command controls speed for maximum run-time or maximum power
   
   
 * Blow tube with built-in scraper allows users to loosen matted leaves and stuck-on debris
   
   
 * Soft grip handle; lightweight at just 4.7 pounds
   
   

Ideal for blowing debris from hard surfaces. Clears patios, decks, walkways, driveways and garages. Low-noise design allows for quiet operation.
